name: eqcov_supp
tagline: Supplementary Materials for Visualizing Tests for Equality of Covariance Matrices
body:
### Supplemental Materials for Visualizing Tests for Equality of Covariance Matrices

This page is intended to serve as an accompaniment to a paper prepared by Dr. Michael Friendly (@friendly) and Matthew Sigal (@mattsigal). The article pertains to the testing for equality of and visualization of covariance matrices in multivariate designs.   

`R` code is provided throughout the article with commentary, and is provided here in fully reproducible form. The code is divided into 4 files: one for each primary example, and one for the work with `betadisper()`.   

| Dataset/Topic | R Script | Rendered HTML |
|:-------------:|:--------:|:-------------:|
|      Iris     |   [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/iris-ex.R)   |      [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/iris-ex.html)     |
|      Wine     |   [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/wine-ex.R)   |      [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/wine-ex.html)     |
|     Skulls    |   [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/skulls-ex.R)   |      [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/skulls-ex.html)     |
|   betadisper  |   [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/betadisp-ex.R)   |      [Link](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/betadisp-ex.html)     |

Questions and commentary can be directed to either @friendly or @mattsigal.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
